title: N-Body Gravity Lab
subject: Physics
insight: Traditional physics lessons are passive data (formulas). This lab turns the formula into active participation: by physically varying mass, the student uses their imagination to predict orbits, turning a lesson plan into a lived experiment.
learningObjectives: Understand gravitational interactions between multiple bodies
Observe how mass affects orbital mechanics
Predict outcomes using inverse square law intuition
teachingNotes: Best used after introducing Newton's law of gravitation. Let students predict orbital paths before running simulations. Ask: 'What happens if we double the mass?'

title: Bio-Emergence Sandbox
subject: Biology
insight: Instead of receiving data about cell division, students actively participate in the creation of life. They imagine a rule, build it, and watch as static lesson plans emerge into complex, breathing ecosystems.
learningObjectives: Understand emergent behavior from simple rules
Connect rules to real biological systems
teachingNotes: Start with the classic 'glider' pattern. Challenge students to find stable configurations. Great for discussing how complex life emerges from simple cellular rules.

title: The Trade Route Engine
subject: History
insight: History is usually a passive reception of dates. This engine requires active imagination: 'If the Silk Road was 100 miles longer, would the empire survive?' The student is no longer a reader; they are the Architect of the outcome.
learningObjectives: Understand trade route economics and logistics
Analyze resource scarcity and strategic decisions
teachingNotes: Pair with primary source documents about the Silk Road. Have students document their 'alternate history' outcomes and compare to actual historical events.

title: The Logic Loop
subject: Programming
insight: A clean Rust implementation of Snake that teaches students about game loops and memory safety without the complexity of a full engine.
teachingNotes: Excellent first introduction to game programming concepts. After playing, show students the source code - it's readable and well-structured for learning.

title: Kinetic Feedback
subject: Physics
insight: Simple pong mechanics teach the basics of angle of incidence and reflexive geometry. High-speed feedback loops keep engagement high.
learningObjectives: Experience angle of incidence through gameplay
teachingNotes: Use this as a warm-up activity before teaching angles. Ask students to predict ball trajectories. Great for kinesthetic learners who need to 'feel' the math.

title: Crystalline Cartography
subject: Geography
insight: Use procedurally generated Minecraft-style worlds to teach topographic mapping and landforms. Every cliff is a math variable.
learningObjectives: Connect terrain features to geological processes
teachingNotes: Have students identify landforms in the generated terrain. Discuss how noise functions create realistic landscapes. Connect to real topographic maps of your region.

title: Historia: The Sequence Engine
subject: History
insight: Teach history as a series of dependencies. Students move events into place until the 'narrative logic' clicks. A masterclass in causal flow.
teachingNotes: Excellent for teaching historical thinking skills. Use as a pre-writing activity before essays. Students can create their own event sequences for peer review.

title: The Electric Shocktopus
subject: Physics
insight: Don't solve for X. Feel the magnetic pull in your fingers. The game world IS the inverse square law.
learningObjectives: Connect game mechanics to physics equations
teachingNotes: Perfect supplement to electromagnetism units. Let students 'feel' the fields before introducing equations. The game makes abstract field lines tangible.

title: Antura & The Letters
subject: Literacy
insight: A dog that wails when you're sad and celebrates when you learn. Lowers the fear of failure in language acquisition.
learningObjectives: Practice letter recognition in a low-stress environment
teachingNotes: Designed for early literacy and ESL learners. The emotional companion reduces anxiety. Consider for students who struggle with traditional phonics approaches.

title: The Sovereign Workstation
subject: Infrastructure
insight: By hosting on your desktop, you eliminate mid-stream data collection. Use Cloudflare Tunnels to bridge your workstation to your students' devices safely.
learningObjectives: Set up secure tunneling for content delivery
teachingNotes: This is the foundation of the Sovereign Ed-Tech approach. Best for educators ready to take control of their infrastructure. Pair with Module 3 of the course.
